message.raw:
Improvement before release of 0.5.0

* Removed click progressbar since you can't capture it when autoscrub is run in a subprocess. Replaced with peridoic print of percentage completion
* Added percentage complete for silence detect which ensures autoscrub is regularly printing to terminal in order to proove it is still doing something
* Moved `format_nice_time` function into autoscrub library from cli.py, renamed it to `seconds_to_hhmmssd` and added optional argument to not included decimal component in the output string
* fixed minor bug in sigterm catching
message.html:
Improvement before release of 0.5.0

  • Removed click progressbar since you can't capture it when autoscrub is run in a subprocess. Replaced with peridoic print of percentage completion
  • Added percentage complete for silence detect which ensures autoscrub is regularly printing to terminal in order to proove it is still doing something
  • Moved format_nice_time function into autoscrub library from cli.py, renamed it to seconds_to_hhmmssd and added optional argument to not included decimal component in the output string
  • fixed minor bug in sigterm catching

message.raw:
Complete subprocess improvements and fixed bugs

* CLI didn't ask for file overwrite confirmation for match-loudness (loudness-adjust)
* Added command line option to each command which enables FFmpeg/ffprobe output (by default this is disabled)
* Added function to autoscrub API to turn on/off ffmpeg/ffprobe terminal output
* Fixed some bugs with paths
* unified subprocess opening and reading so that it works and is safe across all python versions and platforms
* fixed bug where terminal encoding could not be set
* ensured overwrite parameter was accessible from all functions, and was passed to ffmpeg and updated docstring

TODO:
 * percent complete message for ffmpeg output

  • Fixed some bugs with paths
  • unified subprocess opening and reading so that it works and is safe across all python versions and platforms
  • fixed bug where terminal encoding could not be set
  • ensured overwrite parameter was accessible from all functions, and was passed to ffmpeg and updated docstring

Complete subprocess improvements and fixed bugs

* CLI didn't ask for file overwrite confirmation for match-loudness (loudness-adjust)
* Added command line option to each command which enables FFmpeg/ffprobe output (by default this is disabled)
* Added function to autoscrub API to turn on/off ffmpeg/ffprobe terminal output
* Fixed some bugs with paths
* unified subprocess opening and reading so that it works and is safe across all python versions and platforms
* fixed bug where terminal encoding could not be set
* ensured overwrite parameter was accessible from all functions, and was passed to ffmpeg and updated docstring

 * percent complete message for ffmpeg output

message.raw:
Improved subprocess support.

It's now a lot safer, cleaner and subprocesses die when the parent is terminated via SIGINT or SIGTERM (but not if it is forceably killed or crashes...no real way to do this AFAIK)

TODO:
* finish transition away from shell=True (convert string commands to list)
* command line argument (and API option) for enabling/disabling terminal output from ffmpeg/ffprobe
* Add a hook into _agnostic_communicate so that you can process the output in real time (e.g. for a percentage complete bar!)
* test on all platforms and ensure that subprocess32 is installed correctly in readthedocs and by pip on python < 3.2

 command line argument (and API option) for enabling/disabling terminal output from ffmpeg/ffprobe
Add a hook into _agnostic_communicate so that you can process the output in real time (e.g. for a percentage complete bar!)

message.raw:
Fixed bug where autoscrub may try to continue on with processing the video if an early ffmpeg/ffprobe stage failed.

We now raise an exception (`AutoscrubException`) if the return code from any subprocess is not 0.
Bumped version to 0.4.3
message.html:
Fixed bug where autoscrub may try to continue on with processing the video if an early ffmpeg/ffprobe stage failed.

We now raise an exception (AutoscrubException) if the return code from any subprocess is not 0.
Bumped version to 0.4.3

message.raw:
Updated autoscrub to work with Python 3.4+ and fixed a couple of typos.

 * Fixed type when raising click.Abort()
 * Updated subprocess communication to explicitly decode after communication so as not to rely on the special keyword argument to Popen in Python 3.6. We now support Python 3.4+ (and possibly earlier)
 * updated Popen call to always use `shell=True` which is required for running on linux
 * bumped version to 0.4.1
message.html:
Updated autoscrub to work with Python 3.4+ and fixed a couple of typos.

  • Fixed type when raising click.Abort()
  • Updated subprocess communication to explicitly decode after communication so as not to rely on the special keyword argument to Popen in Python 3.6. We now support Python 3.4+ (and possibly earlier)
  • updated Popen call to always use shell=True which is required for running on linux
  • bumped version to 0.4.1

 * Updated subprocess communication to explicitly decode after communication so as not to rely on the special keyword argument to Popen in Python 3.6. We now support Python 3.4+ (and possibly earlier)
 * updated Popen call to always use `shell=True` which is required for running on linux
 * bumped version to 0.4.1
summary.html:

  • Updated subprocess communication to explicitly decode after communication so as not to rely on the special keyword argument to Popen in Python 3.6. We now support Python 3.4+ (and possibly earlier)

values.message:
Updated autoscrub to work with Python 3.4+ and fixed a couple of typos.

 * Fixed type when raising click.Abort()
 * Updated subprocess communication to explicitly decode after communication so as not to rely on the special keyword argument to Popen in Python 3.6. We now support Python 3.4+ (and possibly earlier)
 * updated Popen call to always use `shell=True` which is required for running on linux
 * bumped version to 0.4.1

message.raw:
Updated documentation and licensed the work

* Docstrings in autoscrub are now well formatted
* Provided some examples of using autoscrub autoprocess
* Added requirements file for installing autoscrub through pip/easy_install
* Added requirements file for readthedocs (distinct from the requirements for installing autoscrub)
* Added readme and contributing files for display through bitbucket
* Added contributor agreement PDFs
* Added licence header and COPYING file containing the full licence
* Added automatic version generation in module based on version in setup.py (the generated autoscrub/__version__.py file is now on the hg ignor elist as it will always be regenerated by setup.py and should not be manually edited)
* made a couple of minor changes to the autoscrub API (just cleaning up return data and arguments vs keyword arguments)
* Added ffmpeg/ffprobe check at runtime to command line tool.

  • Provided some examples of using autoscrub autoprocess

  • Added readme and contributing files for display through bitbucket
  • Added contributor agreement PDFs
  • Added licence header and COPYING file containing the full licence
  • Added automatic version generation in module based on version in setup.py (the generated autoscrub/version.py file is now on the hg ignor elist as it will always be regenerated by setup.py and should not be manually edited)
  • made a couple of minor changes to the autoscrub API (just cleaning up return data and arguments vs keyword arguments)
  • Added ffmpeg/ffprobe check at runtime to command line tool.

values.message:
Updated documentation and licensed the work

* Docstrings in autoscrub are now well formatted
* Provided some examples of using autoscrub autoprocess
* Added requirements file for installing autoscrub through pip/easy_install
* Added requirements file for readthedocs (distinct from the requirements for installing autoscrub)
* Added readme and contributing files for display through bitbucket
* Added contributor agreement PDFs
* Added licence header and COPYING file containing the full licence
* Added automatic version generation in module based on version in setup.py (the generated autoscrub/__version__.py file is now on the hg ignor elist as it will always be regenerated by setup.py and should not be manually edited)
* made a couple of minor changes to the autoscrub API (just cleaning up return data and arguments vs keyword arguments)
* Added ffmpeg/ffprobe check at runtime to command line tool.

message.raw:
Modified file/folder structure for package distribution and added sphinx docs folder

* autoscrub.py renamed to austoscrub/__init__.py
* cli.py moved into scripts folder
* setup.py created and configured to create command line shortcut so software can be run via "austoscrub ...." at the command line
* Initialised Sphinx documentation
* Removed monarch and match_loudness files that shouldn't be part of this package

summary.html:
Modified file/folder structure for package distribution and added sphinx docs folder

  • autoscrub.py renamed to austoscrub/init.py
  • cli.py moved into scripts folder
  • setup.py created and configured to create command line shortcut so software can be run via "austoscrub ...." at the command line
  • Initialised Sphinx documentation
  • Removed monarch and match_loudness files that shouldn't be part of this package

values.message:
Modified file/folder structure for package distribution and added sphinx docs folder

* autoscrub.py renamed to austoscrub/__init__.py
* cli.py moved into scripts folder
* setup.py created and configured to create command line shortcut so software can be run via "austoscrub ...." at the command line
* Initialised Sphinx documentation
* Removed monarch and match_loudness files that shouldn't be part of this package

message.raw:
Created first pass at command line interface using `Click`.

currently the command `autoprocess` (run via `python cli.py autoprocess`) is the most complete, mimicing the `if __name__ == '__main__'` block of `autoscrub.py`.

TODO:
 * complete the other commands
 * allow reuse of options between commands so they are all easy to update in one go
 * Fix loudness-adjust command (it currently doesn't work well for large increases in volume). This may imply a misunderstanding of how LUFS and gain are related and we should investigate whether this effects the autoprocess command and whether it explains the increase in background hiss/hum we've sometimes noticed during sped-up portions of the processed video.
 * Create setup.py and restructure the package so it can be installed using pip and run as `autoscrub <command> ...`

values.message:
Created first pass at command line interface using `Click`.

currently the command `autoprocess` (run via `python cli.py autoprocess`) is the most complete, mimicing the `if __name__ == '__main__'` block of `autoscrub.py`.

TODO:
 * complete the other commands
 * allow reuse of options between commands so they are all easy to update in one go
 * Fix loudness-adjust command (it currently doesn't work well for large increases in volume). This may imply a misunderstanding of how LUFS and gain are related and we should investigate whether this effects the autoprocess command and whether it explains the increase in background hiss/hum we've sometimes noticed during sped-up portions of the processed video.
 * Create setup.py and restructure the package so it can be installed using pip and run as `autoscrub <command> ...`

message.raw:
Fixed some bugs in preparation for command line tool:
* uses of isinstance were previously only checking against str, not unicode so unicode strings for options were ignored. We now use the compatibility library `six` to check for instances of strings which has the benefit of being forward compatible with Python 3
* fixed requirement of filename being a global variable
* included delay kwargs in call to `silenceFilterGraph`
* fixed typo in variable name when panning right channel to left channle
message.html:

 fixed requirement of filename being a global variable
included delay kwargs in call to silenceFilterGraph
 fixed typo in variable name when panning right channel to left channle

values.message:
Fixed some bugs in preparation for command line tool:
* uses of isinstance were previously only checking against str, not unicode so unicode strings for options were ignored. We now use the compatibility library `six` to check for instances of strings which has the benefit of being forward compatible with Python 3
* fixed requirement of filename being a global variable
* included delay kwargs in call to `silenceFilterGraph`
* fixed typo in variable name when panning right channel to left channle

message.raw:
Improved audio handling during silent segments

* Added ability to increase tempo or pitch during silent segments
* Added ability to scale the volume during silent segments
* Exposed kwargs for the above features
* Fixed related bug where sample rate was not returned by `getSampleRate` (`getSampleRate` previously called `findDuration` instead of `findSampleRate`)
message.html:
Improved audio handling during silent segments

  • Added ability to increase tempo or pitch during silent segments
  • Added ability to scale the volume during silent segments
  • Exposed kwargs for the above features
  • Fixed related bug where sample rate was not returned by getSampleRate (getSampleRate previously called findDuration instead of findSampleRate)

message.raw:
Separated filtergraph generation for trim + atrim, scale + pad, pan + volume
filters into three separate functions: silenceFilterGraph, resizeFilterGraph, &
panGainAudioGraph. This allowed making the stereo panning & gain both optional.
These are all called by generateFilterGraph, but can be used in isolation.
message.html:
Separated filtergraph generation for trim + atrim, scale + pad, pan + volume
filters into three separate functions: silenceFilterGraph, resizeFilterGraph, &
panGainAudioGraph. This allowed making the stereo panning & gain both optional.
These are all called by generateFilterGraph, but can be used in isolation.

message.raw:
* Moved *heaps* of implementation code (in __main__) into functions:
  ffprobe, findDuration, getDuration, findSampleRate, getSampleRate, getSilences,
  getLoudness, writeFilterGraph, ffmpegComplexFilter.

* Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in __main__
variables are only defined if they are required for a subsequent function call
or for printing statistics/debug information.

* Added trimSegments to trim multiple segments from an input.

* Wrote docstrings for all but generateFilterGraph and writeFilterGraph.

* Made OS independent by replacing NUL (Windows) with os.devnull.

* Renamed script to autoscrub.
message.html:
• Moved heaps of implementation code (in main) into functions:
    ffprobe, findDuration, getDuration, findSampleRate, getSampleRate, getSilences,
    getLoudness, writeFilterGraph, ffmpegComplexFilter.

  • Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in main
    variables are only defined if they are required for a subsequent function call
    or for printing statistics/debug information.

  • Added trimSegments to trim multiple segments from an input.

  • Wrote docstrings for all but generateFilterGraph and writeFilterGraph.

  • Made OS independent by replacing NUL (Windows) with os.devnull.

  • Renamed script to autoscrub.

values.message:
* Moved *heaps* of implementation code (in __main__) into functions:
  ffprobe, findDuration, getDuration, findSampleRate, getSampleRate, getSilences,
  getLoudness, writeFilterGraph, ffmpegComplexFilter.

* Now all ffmpeg and ffprobe calls are made in these functions, and in __main__
variables are only defined if they are required for a subsequent function call
or for printing statistics/debug information.

* Added trimSegments to trim multiple segments from an input.

* Wrote docstrings for all but generateFilterGraph and writeFilterGraph.

* Made OS independent by replacing NUL (Windows) with os.devnull.

* Renamed script to autoscrub.

message.raw:
Working implementation of auto scrub (Camtasia *.trec --> YouTube *.mp4). Notes:
Scripted processing (Python + ffmpeg) of Camtasia recording made on a
Surface Pro 4 with a Focusrite Solo USB sound card and a Sennheiser ew100 G3
wireless mic.

Inputs:
* Sennheiser transmitter gain: -15dB
* Sennheiser reciever AF out: 0dB
* Focusrite pre-amp gain (microphone input, left channel): 5/10
* Windows recording volume: 100%
* Audio format: 44.1kHz, 16 bit, stereo (signal only on left channel)
* Recorded resolution: 2736x1824 (full screen)
* Frame rate: 30fps

Processing (not in order):
* Pan left channel to both left and right
* Loudness measurement using ebur128 filter
* Gain modified (using volume filter) to reach integrated loudness of -18 LUFS
* Silence detection: -18dB threshold (minimum 2 seconds), and a 0.25 sec buffer
* Speed up video during silences by 8x
* Sample only first 1/8th of silence interval without resampling or speed change
* Rescale video to fit 1920 x 1080 display (pillarbox or letterbox as required)
* Convert trec to streamable format as specified by YouTube
